qas.question: What central African warriors are said to cover themselves in red for celebrations?
What does the Ndembu culture believe red symbolizes?
What color do the Ndembu believe is better than red?
What alternative colors does the Red Cross use in certain parts of Africa?
What warriors in Africa rub themselves with red paint during celebrations?

plausible_answers.text: ambivalent, better than black but not as good as white

qas.question: How is red seen in Africa?
What color did the Red Cross change to in Central Africa?
What color are sick people painted with in Africa?

context: In Central Africa, <a0_0><b4_0>Ndembu<b4_0/> warriors<a0_0/> rub themselves with <b7_0>red<b7_0/> paint during celebrations. Since their culture sees the color as a symbol of <a1_0>life and health<a1_0/>, sick people are also painted with it. Like most Central African cultures, the Ndembu see red as <b5_0>ambivalent, better than black but not as good as <a2_0>white<b5_0/><a2_0/>. In other parts of Africa, however, red is a color of mourning, representing death. Because red bears are associated with death in many parts of Africa, the Red Cross has changed its colors to <a3_0><b6_0>green and white<b6_0/><a3_0/> in parts of the continent.
